body.description: Tired of getting tangled? Smooth out your ironing process with the freedom of cordless ironing The unique double-pointed soleplate allows you to iron smoothly and efficiently in any direction and handles tight spots — think collars and cuffs — like a champ The expansive surface area is ideal for large fabrics like curtains and tablecloths Press out the wrinkles in your fabric care routine by going cordless

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very light and cord free, excellent for sewists
reviews.reviewText: I use this iron in my sewing room to press seams, interfacing, etc. It does get hot enough to do this, and does a fine job. It is small and light enough to get into small spaces. It is also small enough that I can use it in my embroidery hoop to press tacked down applique pieces. The cord free feature is wonderful. The auto off is not a big deal, as it heats very quickly. It is a perfect light duty iron, easily pressing low wrinkle pieces for a crisp finish, with good steam. I especially like this iron as it does not heat up my sewing room, a plus in Arizona in the summer. I have not found it useful for very wrinkled fabric or clothing - for this I use my Rowenta, which gets very hot and generates tremendous heat.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2022
reviews.reviewText: This is by far the most expensive iron I have ever bought but it is absolutely worth the price! I will never go back to a corded iron again. This baby is a delight to use! It's lightweight but presses beautifully. The ceramic sole slides like a dream. I love the detachable water reservoir -- no more spilling water all over the ironing board trying to fill the iron! It did take me a little while to get into the habit of putting it back in its cradle every time I wanted to set it down -- you can't just stand it on its end like a regular iron. But that's a small price to pay for going cordless. Also, with it pointy on both ends I find that I don't accidentally iron in wrinkles as often as I used to. It heats up pretty quickly, and the heat lasts plenty long for my purposes -- you can only iron as much as fits on the ironing board, and then you have to set the iron down and rearrange the cloth or whatever. When you're ready to iron again it's all heated up and ready to go.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love this iron. So lightweight, irons beautifully and love no cord. Great for my quilting and sewing. I saw a negative comment before buying re it cuts off after 10 minutes and I have been sewing up a storm since getting it and no problem with that whatsoever. If it does cut off it heats up really fast. Super iron. Highly recommend it. It does the job really well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cordless = Freedom to Move Effortlessly!
reviews.reviewText: I don't know why I waited so long to buy this Panasonic Cordless Iron! Auto-shutoff, Ceramic sole plate that glides so smoothly, lightweight, compact and most important to me....it's Cordless! No tripping over the cords and trying to find an electrical outlet close to my sewing station. I absolutely love it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Ease of use and convenience.
reviews.reviewText: I like the color, shape and convince of this iron for my quilting projects. I have two, one for upstairs and one for downstairs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Scary to say about a clothes iron--BUT this is a fabulous machine !!!!
reviews.reviewText: It is effective dry. It is ergonomically divine. After reading through all the instructions, which are many, I know how it operates. WHAT a superb purchase !!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for quilters!
reviews.reviewText: I use this portable iron beside my sewing machine to press seams open as I sew.I would not expect it to iron shirts etc. The iron get hot and stays hot for a few minutes and then it needs to be put in it’s stand. This has great steam and does not burn your hand.I enjoy using this portable iron and I love the aqua!
